metadata.title: CVE-2023-25737 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description: An invalid downcast from nsTextNode to SVGElementcould have lead to undefined behavior. This vulnerability affects Firefox <110, Thunderbird < 102.8, and Firefox ESR < 102.8. Update Instructions: Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25737` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions: firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1 No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
